title: [BEAM-11331] Change region flag to awsRegion in io.aws2
body:
The original `AwsOptions` has a flat `region`, which is in conflict with the one in `DataflowPipelineOptions` This PR renames the flag, matching the ver1 sdk (io.aws). ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11327] Replace Charset.defaultCharset() with StandardCharsets.UTF_8
body:
**Please** add a meaningful description for your change here Replace Charset.defaultCharset() with StandardCharsets.UTF_8 so that reliance on encoding set in `locale` is not used. The [defaultCharset()](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/nio/charset/Charset.html#defaultCharset()) method relies on underlying OS system default. Files that are NOT test files that are being changed: * `runners/flink/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/flink/FlinkPortableClientEntryPoint.java` * `runners/google-cloud-dataflow-java/worker/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/dataflow/worker/logging/JulHandlerPrintStreamAdapterFactory.java` * `sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/schemas/utils/AvroUtils.java` * `sdks/java/extensions/google-cloud-platform-core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/extensions/gcp/util/GceMetadataUtil.java` * `sdks/java/io/snowflake/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/snowflake/KeyPairUtils.java` * `sdks/java/io/snowflake/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/snowflake/crosslanguage/ReadBuilder.java` * `sdks/java/io/snowflake/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/snowflake/services/SnowflakeBatchServiceImpl.java` ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [WIP][BEAM-11323] Add support for Date logical type to Beam Schema
body:
This change modifies the AVRO logical type date from being mapped to DATETIME to being mapped to LOGICAL_TYPE Date. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10703, BEAM-10475] Add GroupIntoBatches to runner API; add Dataflow override in Python SDK
body:
This PR adds `GroupIntoTransform.WithShardedKey` to the runner api as a well-known composite transform and also adds the non-sharded version `GroupIntoBatches` as a component there of. This allows runners to recognize and choose the sharding approach for `GroupIntoTransform.WithShardedKey`. This PR also adds a Dataflow override of `GroupIntoTransform.WithShardedKey` in Python for non-portable job submission, analogous to the Java implementation (#13208). For portable job submission, the changes will be done in the Dataflow service instead of in SDK. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Nexmark: fix typos and clean unused options
body:
This removes some unused options from launcher, fixes the justModelResultRate mode by fixing the formatting string, uses the right name for the SessionSideInputJoin and renames the argument in one launcher option, just for consistency. The removal of the unused options could break some test setups somewhere, but I see this as a minimal concern. It will not affect any production pipelines and the amount of people regularly running the NEXMark benchmark with old unused options. Alternative is to use the `@Hidden` annotation and note in the docstrings that they are not in use. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-11324] Add additional verification in PartitioningSession
body:
This PR modifies `PartitioningSession` so it re-executes expressions with a variety of partitioned inputs, determined by the expression's `requires_partition_by` specification. It also verifies that the output for each type of partitioned input is partitioned consistent with the expression's `preserves_partition_by` specification. This detected the issue fixed in https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/13398, and detected an additional issue with Series.agg's pre-aggregation, fixed in ac1e3a. Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-11312] Log cloud build url and enable kaniko cache in sdk_container_builder
body:
iner_builder This PR adds logging for the build history url in the case the google cloud build run failed, and also enables kaniko cache for better build performance as https://cloud.google.com/cloud-build/docs/kaniko-cache suggested. Experiment shows with kaniko cache, the build time for is greatly reduced after initial build. This helps user to launch job faster with prebuilt python sdk workflow. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Decode data channel elements after, rather than before, placing them in the queue.
body:

title: [BEAM-11308] Update deprecated Google GitHub action
body:
[**GoogleCloudPlatform/github-actions/setup-gcloud**](https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/github-actions/) became deprecated and it is recommended to use [**google-github-actions/setup-gcloud**](https://github.com/google-github-actions/setup-gcloud) ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-11304] groupby(Series).size() on a filtered dataframe is incorrect
body:
Prior to this change `df[df.value > x].groupby(df.group).size()` produces sizes of the unfiltered dataset. title: [BEAM-11303] Use sum as the post-agg for size
body:
The size aggregator is not associative. We can lift it, but the post aggregation needs to be a sum. This PR also adds an implementation for `count`, which is also post-aggregated with a sum. title: [BEAM-11208] Fix for QUOTA_EXCEEDED failures in BQ Storage streams sp
body:
Fix for BigQuery storage streams failing with QUOTA_EXCEEDED errors in split. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10896] Support ZetaSQL UNNEST syntax on array of struct type
body:
CalciteSQL and ZetaSQL have different ways of handling UNNEST an array of struct type. In order to not break CalciteSQL dialect, enable different rules and rels for ZetaSQL dialect: - `ZetaSqlUnnest` to replace Calcite `Uncollect` - `BeamZetaSqlUncollectRel` to replace Calcite `BeamUncollectRel` (uncorrelated case) - `BeamZetaSqlUncollectRule` to replace Calcite `BeamUncollectRule` (uncorrelated case) - `BeamZetaSqlUnnestRel` to replace Calcite `BeamUnnestRel` (correlated case) - `BeamZetaSqlUnnestRule` to replace Calcite `BeamUnnestRule` (correlated case) This is a temporary solution before we upgrade vendored Calcite to >= 1.23.0. After upgrade we may use the "set struct alias" feature to simplify the solution. See details in the JIRA. r: @apilloud Post-Commit Tests Status (on master branch) ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Lang | SDK | Dataflow | Flink | Samza | Spark | Twister2 --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- Go | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- Java | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/)

title: Make UsesTestStream extend UsesUnboundedPCollections for exclusion in batch-only runners
body:
Before this change, batch-only runners would have to exclude both `UsesTestStream` and `UsesUnboundedPCollections`. This is a tiny usability improvement of the categories to make it easy to indicate a batch-only runner with a single exclusion. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-8106] Add Java 11 container to release and Java 11+V2+Dataflow testing
body:

title: [BEAM-11316] Fix Windmill timer tag output timestamp decoding
body:

title: [BEAM-11207] Adding PipelineResult to session runner.
body:
Unit tests were failing because Execute could no longer be used with RegisterRunner. This should fix that. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-11188] Adding unit test for mergeExpandedWithPipeline
body:
This is meant to be part of a larger change adding unit tests for the various pipeline transformations in graphx/xlang.go. After how long it took to figure out how to implement this, and the realization that each other transformation is going to be similarly difficult and they're already somewhat tested by the xlang examples (and soon-to-be integration tests), I think I'd rather not implement the rest anymore. But I already implemented most of this test so I just finished it up and am sending it out in a PR. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-9615] Switch options for logical types.
body:
Turns out Logical Types were the correct way to solve the int problem. Who knew? This only tests the "to and from schema" type specifications half, and not the encoding decoding half of logical types, so those conversions are subject to change. However, I wanted to get this part in because I'm working on not needing to write similar structures for encoders, decoders, toSchemas, and FromSchemas for all the provisioning as well. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11075] Pardo tests for Go SDK
body:
This PR adds ParDo load tests for Go SDK. The PR also contains some helper functions for measuring and sending test run times to InfluxDB. The results will become visible on Grafana dashboard as soon as the related Jenkins job starts running periodically. Lastly, the PR introduces a new option: `parallelism`, which can be used to set the degree of Flink's parallelism. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11196] Cherry-pick #13303 to the 2.26.0 release branch.
body:
#13202 introduces a bug where the algorithm that determines the parents of fused stage can create loops, because the lowest common ancestor algorithm considers a transform to be its own parent. Fusing a single transform A will result cause the fused stage's parent to be set to A. Fusing a transform A with a descendant B will also cause fused stage's parent to be set to A. To fix this, if the parent of the fused stage would be one of transforms to be fused, set the parent to the parent of that transform instead. This is a cherry pick of #13303. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11266] Python IO MongoDB: add bucket_auto aggregation option for bundling in Atlas.
body:
This fixes issue BEAM-11266 allowing to use ReadFromMongoDB with MongoDB Atlas by optionally using `@bucketAuto` MongoDB aggregation instead of `splitVector`: ``` pipeline | ReadFromMongoDB(uri='mongodb+srv://user:pwd@cluster0.mongodb.net', db='testdb', coll='input', bucket_auto=True) ``` This enhancement is based on the solution, provided by Susumu Asaga in this [comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-4567?focusedCommentId=17152256&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-17152256) to the issue BEAM-4567, related to Java MongoDB connector. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [release-2.26.0][BEAM-11264] Add Reshuffle in pd.read_*
body:
Another fix for using DataframeTransform at scale. Without this it's not possible to distribute reading distinct files on distinct workers. title: [BEAM-4136] Keep strong reference to loggers to avoid potential NPE
body:
I haven't found evidence that this is the cause but I strongly suspect the cause of the NPE on this line: https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/43e8b990b19d9ad3031b06e3c3dea508d0916d93/sdks/java/harness/src/test/java/org/apache/beam/fn/harness/logging/BeamFnLoggingClientTest.java#L162 is that the `Logger` corresponding to `"ConfiguredLogger"` has been GC'd. The javadoc for `Logger.getLogger` notes: > Note: The LogManager may only retain a weak reference to the newly created Logger. It is important to understand that a previously created Logger with the given name may be garbage collected at any time if there is no strong reference to the Logger. Once the client is closed the only reference to the logger is removed and there's the possibility it gets GC'd before we try to access it for the assertion. This PR also removes warning suppression in BeamFnLoggingClient. title: [BEAM-11263] Java cleanUpDockerImages now force removes container images.
body:
Jenkins jobs were failing, rarely, when attempting to delete the container image because the container was not removed first. This is likely due to a race between shutting down the container and removing the container image. Since this is a test, it is safe to force remove the image and assume the container will be shutdown properly. If there is actually a problem here with the containers not shutting down, it should manifest as a memory related exception on the Jenkins agent and be quite a spectacular failure (i.e. easy to notice). ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11260][BEAM-11261] Remove inappropriate assumptions about repo from linkage check script
body:
This updates the beam linkage check script to be simpler to use and also removes incorrect assumptions. Now you just pass the refs you want to compare and that is that. A few minor fixes, too. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Avoid unnecessary shuffling for single-input elementwise operations.

title: [BEAM-11262] Remove numSleeps assertion in SpannerIOWriteTest
body:
We shouldn't make an assertion about the number of times the writer slept, this is verifying the backoff policy which is an implementation detail. The test already verifies the total amount of time slept, which is more appropriate. title: [BEAM-10921]: Fix BEAM-10921 and underlying issues
body:
Worst issue of BEAM-10921 was clearing the InteractiveEnvironment when other tests were running. This caused the flakiness. Fixing this, it was shown that getting the user_pipeline was broken due to an incorrect assumption that PCollection proto IDs were unique across all pipelines. After fixing this, I found that the pipeline.py clobbers the pipeline reference when doing a run() with different a new pipeline reference given to the run_pipeline() method. Other places also had non-idempotent testing, and a new limiter interface was added to the BackgroundCachingJob. The fixes are, unfortunately, interlinked with each other and a single PR must be made to fix all at once. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Further dataframe batch consolidation.
body:
* Concatenate small dataframe before shuffle. * Omit shuffling of empty partitions. - This requires some adjustment to use the proxy object if *all* partitions from all workers are empty. Projections, filterings, and aggregations are common operations that often greatly reduce the size of a dataframe, and can result in small output batches which have high relative overhead. This is in reaction to looking at the number of (relatively tiny) elements in the dataflow ui. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: Fixes silent fail in bigtableio.py by logging ImportError

title: [BEAM-9782] Update README for instructions on updating katas
body:
This PR updates the Go SDK katas README for instructions on how to update content and gotchas found when working with Stepik specifically for Go. I would like to request @lostluck to review this PR. The Stepik course does not need to be updated with this PR and can be merged if accepted. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-11188] Refactor Go xlang expansion from runners to core.
body:
Moving the xlangx calls out of universal.go and into graphx/translate.go caused a dependency loop (graphx -> xlangx -> graphx), so in order to break the cycle I moved all xlangx calls that were used in graphx directly into graphx, so now it looks like this: xlangx -> graphx. Most of those calls were in translate.go, so I just moved the contents of that file into graphx/xlang.go, which is a sensible place for it anyway since it's a lot of code modifying proto pipelines. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Require Pandas 1.x for dataframes.
body:
Issues were encountered in mixing 0.x and 1.x across construction and execution. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11256] Get writer method from dataframe at execution time
body:
This avoids pickling the writer method that exists at construction time for use at construction time, which can lead to issues if the pandas version in the worker is different from the one in the construction environment. title: [BEAM-11255] Adding upper bound on urllib3 dependency
body:
This helps fix the issues trying to install boto3. The incompatibility comes from these ranges: ``` * botocore==1.19.16 - urllib3 [required: >=1.25.4,<1.26, installed: 1.26.1] - requests [required: >=2.24.0,<3.0.0, installed: 2.25.0] - urllib3 [required: >=1.21.1,<1.27, installed: 1.26.1] ``` The error surfaces like this: ``` botocore 1.19.16 has requirement urllib3<1.26,>=1.25.4; python_version != "3.4", but you have urllib3 1.26.1. ``` ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11173] Add Bigtable table with read operation
body:
Added Bigtable table provider with simple read operation - filters and write will be done in another one in the near future. Problems: BeamSQL doesn't support `ARRAY`. If you use ``` CREATE TABLE test( key VARCHAR, family ROW>> ) ``` and then `SELECT t.key, t.family.q1 FROM test t` Calcite shouts that it couldn't parse the generated code. What is possible is of little value: `SELECT t.key, t.family.q1[0] FROM test t` So it's blocked to select all cells with timestamp and labels for now, but as I read about Bigtable it's usually not the desired case (the schema advice is to have single value per cell and usually only the latest value is needed). I used `val` instead of `value` because value is a keyword in SQL and hence would need to be used with backslashes. For the Flat approach I followed the Spark's approach [1] For the Row schema I combined Flink's approach [2] (with only latest values) and Bigquery's approach [3] (with possibility of using ROW) [1] https://stackoverflow.com/questions/39530938/sparksql-on-hbase-tables [2] https://ci.apache.org/projects/flink/flink-docs-stable/dev/table/connectors/hbase.html [3] https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/rest/v2/tables#bigtableoptions ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11300] Improve Nexmark performance:
body:
Change Query3 to use stateful processing and timers without CoGroupByKey which introduces additional windowing and shuffling. Also use BagState instead of ValueState> Change Query5 to avoid unnecessary lists when combining. Change Query10 to avoid excessive logging. **Please** add a meaningful description for your change here ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-9980] do not hardcode Python version for cross language tests and make it switchable.

Define Python versions for CrossLanguageValidatesRunner jobs as property. affected jobs: ``` beam_PostCommit_XVR_Direct beam_PostCommit_XVR_Flink beam_PostCommit_XVR_Spark ``` ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-11253] Account for overheads for small/empty Dataframes and fix ReBatch.
body:
------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier).
